doc.repnme: Water supply and sanitation in poverty reduction strategy papers (PRSP) : benchmarking performance
doc.abstracts: Poverty Reduction Strategy Papers (PRSPs) are policy instruments designed to mainstream poverty into national planning frameworks. This study sought to benchmark how different countries in Sub-Saharan Africa incorporate water supply and sanitation (WSS) into the PRSP process, with additional research into broader sector issues. The study builds on a previous study conducted by WSP-Africa in 2003. The research highlighted a few key lessons: firstly, it is the context in which the PRSP is developed, rather than the PRSP document itself, that most strongly influences whether a country, province, or community will be successful in implementing sustainable activities to improve water, sanitation, and hygiene. Secondly, while the PRSP itself does not seem to drive change, the PRSP process can help to bridge sector planning with broader macro-economic and budgeting decisions by government. Finally, it should be noted that those countries that were early adopters of incorporating WSS in their PRSPs continue to strengthen their strategic planning process.
